body:
Don't think I did, but I'm sorry if I already brought this up previously (too many projects in parallel right now):

It is the case that:
```sh
$ spack --version
0.10.0
```
is reported also for the develop branch (and any other branches), correct?  That's what it looks like to me after coming back to Spack after several weeks, but I want to make sure that's the case.

Also, I might already have suggested to use a larger version number do indicate that's it different from the most recent release, e.g.
```sh
$ spack --version
0.10.0.9000
```
for develop branch(es).  As long as that 'extra' in x.y.z-extra is there, I am happy; I don't really need it to increase for every single commit / push as long as it's a very clear indicator that I'm running something different that stable release and that can pass a version comparison `x.y.z < x.y.z.extra < x.y.z+1`.  (The `.9000` suffix has become a de-facto standard in the R community.)
title: 'spack --version' to give x.y.z-extra for non-release versions
